title: How to Buy a Gaming Laptop

steps.headline: Make sure the laptop has a good processor.
steps.description: Intel is known for having better processors them AMD; however, AMD is much cheaper. Try getting an I5, I7, R5 or R7.

steps.headline: Watch out for graphics.
steps.description: If you have a bad graphics card your laptop will not be able to run games. So, you have to watch out for that really carefully. Buy a laptop with AMD Radeon graphics card. Those are not too expensive and are really good. The 7730M model is a good start, since it is not expensive and it can run most games on high settings.

steps.headline: Get as much RAM as you can afford.
steps.description: Your gaming laptop needs at least 8GB of RAM. If it doesn't, don't buy it. You'll get the best performance with 8GB or higher of RAM.

steps.headline: Have a big hard drive.
steps.description: It is not that important, but you have to be aware that you can't put additional hard drives in laptops and you know that games require a lot of space on hard drive. So if you run out of space, you will have to buy external hard drives which are not that fast when they are "out".

steps.headline: Buy laptops with extra years of guarantee.
steps.description: Some companies offer 1 year, and that is definitely not enough. At least 2 years of guarantee can guarantee you longer laptop life. For example, DELL offers laptops with 3 years of guarantee, and they also have really good laptops. You should probably check them out first.

steps.headline: If you have extra money, buy a laptop with an SSD.
steps.description: They are really fast, and with that in your laptop, you are ready to go!
